alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 7:16PM CDT until April 06 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Tennessee...Arkansas... Mississippi River at Memphis For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, APRIL 06... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Memphis. * WHEN...Until Thursday, April 06. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, in Arkansas, the evacuation route from camps south of Hopefield Chute is cut off. Water is lapping at the levee near Sulcer Road west of South Lake. River is touching the levee at Blue Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.1 feet early Monday morning. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
